tn.ref: The word of Yahweh of hosts came to me and said
tn.text: Yahweh of hosts said to me

tn.ref: I am passionate for her with great anger
tn.text: AT: "I am filled with anger for the sake of Zion"

tn.ref: the mountain of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This refers to Mount Zion.

tn.ref: The Holy Mountain
tn.text: Here "Holy" means "Belonging to Yahweh."

tn.ref: be in the streets of Jerusalem
tn.text: "be living in Jerusalem"

tn.ref: in his hand because he has grown so old
tn.text: Having the opportunity to grow old is a sign of peace and prosperity.

tn.ref: The streets of the city will be full
tn.text: The public areas of the city will be full of people in their normal activities.

tn.ref: If something seems impossible in the eyes of
tn.text: "If something does not appear to be possible to"

tn.ref: the remnant of this people
tn.text: AT: "the people of Judah who survive"

tn.ref: should it also seem impossible in my eyes?
tn.text: God is asking this question in order to persuade his people to trust in his promises. AT: "it will surely be possible for me!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: this is Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: I am about to rescue my people
tn.text: "I am about to rescue my people of Judah who went into exile" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: when the foundation of my house was laid
tn.text: AT: "when the foundation of my temple was set in place" to "when you were building the foundation of my house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Strengthen your hands
tn.text: AT: "Work hard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: For before those days
tn.text: AT: "Before you started to rebuild the temple"

tn.ref: no crops were gathered in
tn.text: AT: "there were no crops to harvest"

tn.ref: there was no profit for either man or beast
tn.text: It was useless for people and their animals to farm the land, because they got no food from it.

tn.ref: as in former days
tn.text: "as in the past;"

tn.ref: I will be with the remnant of this people
tn.text: AT: "Now I will bless these people" or "Now I will treat these people kindly"

tn.ref: seeds of peace will be sown
tn.text: AT: "I will make the people be at peace."

tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: the earth will give its produce
tn.text: AT: "there will be good harvests in the fields"

tn.ref: the skies will give their dew
tn.text: Dew was often a symbol of prosperity. AT: "there will be much rain"

tn.ref: inherit all these things
tn.text: AT: "have all these things for all time"

tn.ref: You were an example to the other nations of a curse
tn.text: AT: "When I punished you, the other nations learned what happens when I curse someone"

tn.ref: house of Judah and house of Israel
tn.text: "people of Judah and Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: let your hands be strong!
tn.text: AT: "work hard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: do harm to you
tn.text: "punish you"

tn.ref: provoked my anger
tn.text: "angered me"

tn.ref: did not relent
tn.text: "did not decide to punish them less"

tn.ref: that you must do
tn.text: "You" refers to the people of Judah.

tn.ref: Speak truth, every person with his neighbor
tn.text: AT: "Tell the truth to every person"

tn.ref: Judge with truth, justice, and peace in your gates
tn.text: AT: "Judge disputes justly in your places of judgment so that people can live in peace with each other"

tn.ref: do not love false oaths
tn.text: AT: "do not approve when people tell lies in court cases"

tn.ref: this is Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: Then the word of Yahweh of hosts came to me
tn.text: "Me" refers to Zechariah.

tn.ref: The fasts of the fourth month
tn.text: The Jews mourned during a part of the fourth month of the Hebrew calendar because this is when the Babylonians broke through the walls of Jerusalem. The fourth month is during the last part of June and the first part of July on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: fifth month
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:07:01|7:3]].

tn.ref: seventh month
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:07:04|7:5]].

tn.ref: tenth month
tn.text: The Jews mourned during a part of the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar because this is when the Babylonians began their siege against Jerusalem. The tenth month is during the last part of December and the first part of January on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: People will come again
tn.text: "People will come to Jerusalem again"

tn.ref: Many people and mighty nations will come
tn.text: "Many people will come, including people from large nations"

tn.ref: will grasp the hem of your robe
tn.text: "will grasp your clothes to get your attention" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Let us go with you
tn.text: "Please let us travel to Jerusalem with you"

tn.ref: God is with you
tn.text: "God is with you people"
